frame.name: Recovery
frame.definition:
<def-root>These words describe the recovery or healing of a <fen>Patient</fen> from an <fen>Affliction</fen> without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame). <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Affliction">My injuries</fex> had not yet <fex name="Degree">completely</fex> <t>healed</t>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Patient">Henley MP Michael Heseltine</fex>, <t>recovering</t> <fex name="Affliction">from a heart attack</fex> got a very public get well card.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Patient
FE.definition: <def-root>The Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of FE conflation): <ex><fex name="Patient">Pat</fex> is <t>convalescing</t> from surgery.</ex> <ex>Pat's wound is <t>healing</t>.</ex> In the second example, <ment>Pat's wound</ment> is the <fen>Body_part</fen>, but <ment>Pat's</ment> is also an instantiation of the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Affliction
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient. Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs: <ex><fex name="Affliction">The wound</fex> is <t>healing</t> well.</ex> <ex><fex name="Affliction">Pat's wound</fex> is <t>healing</t> well.</ex> <ex>Pat is <t>recovering</t> <fex name="Affliction">from scarlet fever</fex>.</ex> <ex>Pat's <t>recovery</t> <fex name="Affliction">from scarlet fever</fex> was very rapid. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition: <def-root>Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument: <ex><fex name="Body_part">Pat's arm</fex> <t>healed</t> up quickly.</ex> Body Part is treated as a separate Frame Element although it may be viewed as metonymic for Affliction. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Patient</fen>'s state diverges from their former illness.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act of the <fen>Patient</fen> that results in their recovery. <ex>You will <t>recover</t> more quickly <fex name="Mns">by getting simple bed-rest</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Company
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual or group of individuals that the <fen>Patient</fen> is generally in the presence of during convalescence.
<ex>She had confidently expected to <t>convalesce</t> <fex name="Company">with her brother and his wife</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the recovery takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the recovery takes place.</def-root>
